name: New Year's Day
description: The first day of the year, celebrated with various festivities and traditions.

name: Union Day
description: Commemorates the signing of the Panglong Agreement in 1947, which paved the way for independence.

name: Peasants' Day
description: A day to honor and recognize the contributions of farmers and agricultural workers.

name: Full Moon Day of Tabaung
description: A Buddhist festival marking the end of the month of Tabaung.

name: Armed Forces Day
description: Celebrates the founding of the modern Myanmar military in 1945.

name: Thingyan Festival
description: The Myanmar New Year Water Festival, celebrated with water throwing and various cultural activities.

name: Labor Day
description: An international holiday to celebrate workers and labor movements.

name: Full Moon Day of Kason
description: Marks the day when Buddha was born, attained enlightenment, and passed away.

name: Martyrs' Day
description: Commemorates the assassination of General Aung San and eight others in 1947.

name: Full Moon Day of Waso
description: Marks the beginning of the Buddhist Lent, a time of retreat and meditation.

name: Full Moon Day of Thadingyut
description: Marks the end of the Buddhist Lent, celebrated with lighting festivals and merit-making.

name: Full Moon Day of Tazaungmone
description: Celebrates the offering of new robes to monks and the lighting of oil lamps.

name: National Day
description: Commemorates the start of the student-led protests against British rule in 1920.

name: Christmas Day
description: Celebrates the birth of Jesus Christ, observed by the Christian community in Myanmar.
